titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Thomas Barclay Papers
1812-1815
MS 43
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:38 -0400.

did.abstract:
The collection consists of correspondence and papers pertaining to Thomas Barclay's activities and duties during 1812-1815 as agent. Much of his correspondence was with his American counterpart, John Mason, Commissary General of Prisoners for the U.S., on the subject of the exchange of prisoners, parole, treatment, and whereabouts. Barclay was an agent for the relief of British prisoners of war in America during the War of 1812.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Thomas Barclay papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.
